metadata.feature_description: Add, remove and manage tags for articles with tag-based filtering

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki Test page and observe articles with tags displayed
steps.expected: Articles should display with clickable tag links
steps.actual: Articles displayed with tags (test, wiki, article, testtag, documentation, test@tag#1, technology, programming, bookmark)

steps.action: Click on 'bookmark' tag link on Test Article for Bookmarks
steps.expected: Article list should filter to show only articles with the 'bookmark' tag
steps.actual: Article list filtered successfully, showing 1 article with 'bookmark' tag

steps.action: Type 'wiki' in the 'Filter by tag' input field
steps.expected: Article list should filter to show only articles with 'wiki' tag
steps.actual: Article list filtered successfully, showing 1 article with 'wiki' tag (Test Article Draft)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add single tag to new article

steps.action: Click 'Create article' button to open the article creation dialog
steps.expected: Article creation dialog should open with tags field visible
steps.actual: Dialog opened with Title, Article Type, Content, Tags fields visible

steps.action: Enter 'singletag' in the tags input field and press Enter
steps.expected: Tag should be added as a chip in the tags field
steps.actual: Tag 'singletag' added successfully and displayed as a removable chip

steps.action: Enter 'multipletag1' in the tags input field and press Enter
steps.expected: Second tag should be added to the tags field

steps.action: Enter 'multipletag2' in the tags input field and press Enter
steps.expected: Third tag should be added to the tags field
steps.actual: Tag 'multipletag2' added successfully, now showing three tags: singletag, multipletag1, multipletag2

steps.action: Click the 'x' remove button on the 'multipletag1' tag chip
steps.expected: Tag 'multipletag1' should be removed from the tags field
steps.actual: Tag 'multipletag1' removed successfully, now showing two tags: singletag, multipletag2

steps.action: Enter 'special@char#tag!' in the tags input field and press Enter
steps.expected: Tag with special characters should be accepted and added
steps.actual: Tag 'special@char#tag!' added successfully with special characters preserved

steps.action: Observe existing article 'Test Article for Tagging' which has tag 'test@tag#1'
steps.expected: Special characters should be displayed and functional in existing tags
steps.actual: Tag 'test@tag#1' displayed correctly with @ and # characters

steps.action: Enter 'CaseSensitiveTag' in the tags input field and press Enter
steps.expected: Tag should be added with mixed case preserved
steps.actual: Tag 'CaseSensitiveTag' added successfully with original case

steps.action: Enter 'casesensitivetag' (all lowercase) in the tags input field and press Enter
steps.expected: System should either reject as duplicate or add as separate tag
steps.actual: Tag 'casesensitivetag' added as a separate tag, confirming tags are case-sensitive

steps.action: Review code in dnn.wiki.ContentEditor.js for tag input implementation
steps.expected: Tag input should use dnnTagsInput plugin with autocomplete capability
steps.actual: Code confirms dnnTagsInput plugin is used with autocomplete source pointing to GetSuggestions API endpoint

steps.action: Observe tags input field behavior when typing
steps.expected: Input field should accept tags with Enter key or comma separator
steps.actual: Tags input accepts tags when pressing Enter key, placeholder shows 'Enter tags separated by a comma'

observations: Tag cloud feature mentioned in test scenarios is not visible in the Wiki UI - no dedicated tag cloud component or visualization exists. Tags are displayed inline with articles and can be clicked for filtering.
Existing article 'Test Article for Tagging' already has a tag with special characters (test@tag#1), confirming special character support is working in production.
The tagging system uses the DNN Taxonomy system via TermController for tag storage and management.
Tags are case-sensitive - 'CaseSensitiveTag' and 'casesensitivetag' are treated as different tags.
Tag filtering works via URL parameters (e.g., ?tags=tagname) which allows bookmarkable filtered views.
The dnnTagsInput jQuery plugin provides the tag input UI with chip-style display and remove buttons.
